game.title: ThirtyThree Games Ltd.
game.description: RUNGUNJUMPGUN is a retro-style 2D automatic-runner with two-button controls. One button let’s you fly, the other blasts your obstacles into heaps of rubble. There is no stopping in RUNGUNJUMPGUN’s surreal fantasy-sci-fi world. There is only running, gunning, and jumping.

history.text: The team behind RUNGUNJUMPGUN met as employees at a marketing company in Alberta, Canada. When Matthew and Logan (artist and programmer on the project) quit in late 2014, they planned to create a small video game as a farewell card to their colleagues. Jordan joined shortly after to compose music and act as writer for the project as the scope of RunGunJumpGun expanded into a full title. RunGunJumpGun was Greenlit for distribution on the Steam Marketplace in December 2015.

features.feature: Merciful respawns let you die with efficiency and keep you in the game.
Meticulously crafted levels, created by the shrewdest level-artisans, designed to hone and test player’s speed and tenacity.
Single-hand gameplay appropriate for players with disabilities.
Pulsing musical score blending hip hop, electronic and movie-score vibes.
Warped space-opera narrative and a cast of crazed, beautifully illustrated characters.
The quest to collect “Atomiks” littered throughout levels lends an extra level of insanity to already merciless level design. A gift to self-hating completionists.

quote.description: Pulsing stages filled with brilliant color, screen-shaking gunfire, and pounding sound.
quote.name: Joel Couture

quote.description: Looks to be absolutely brutal. And colorful too. You can't ignore those vibrant colors.
quote.name: Chris Priestman
